citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
A category E protocol (220603) did not include a search term for the method of death, drowning, in pitfall traps of small
mammals. This method does not meet the definition of euthanasia, ('the humane destruction of an animal accomplished
by a method that produces rapid unconsciousness and subsequent death without evidence of pain or distress'), and the
IACUC must be assured that a thorough search for alternatives was performed. The facility must ensure that an
appropriate search for and evaluation of alternatives is done.
Correct by 30 August 2024.

The annual report did not include an explanation of the category E procedure on protocol 220603. Documentation of the
use of animals annually, with discussion of any IACUC approved exceptions to standards and regulations under the AWA,
ensures public accountability for animal research. The facility must ensure that the annual report fully describes all animal
use.
Correct by 30 August 2024.

The dairy barn had multiple sites where use and/or animals had damaged the facility: a rusted sharp end of a pole on the
walkway (@2x4"), a rusted sharp edged hole at the bottom of a metal pillar at the edge of the milking parlor (@4x8"), two
sharp edged holes in the metal wall covering in the heifer pen (@6x10"), and an @ 3x16" loose, flapping sharp plastic
edge portion of a calf hutch. The damages to the facilities represent injury risks to the animals. The facility must ensure
that animal handling and holding areas are kept in good repair to prevent injury to the animals.
Correct by 06 August 2024
The ceiling of the dairy barn had excessive dust/dirt/manure present over the animal stalls in large sections near the
ceiling fans. The buildup of dirt and excreta may be detrimental to the health of the animals. and prevent the fans from
appropriately functioning to circulate air and cool the barn. The facility must ensure that the premises are kept clean and
in good repair to facilitate appropriate husbandry practices.
Correct by 30 August 2024.
The top of the water heater in the calf treatment room was covered in dirt, white soap powder, and rust on the electrical
connections, and the room itself was dirty, with manure and debris present on the floor and surfaces. Corrosion and
damage to the water heater may prevent correct function and lack of housekeeping in the room may lead to
contamination of feed or medication prepared in that area, which can impact animal health.
The facility must ensure that the premises shall be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
Correct by 06 August 2024.

Three of the large suspended ceiling fans had bird nests built into and upon them. The nests are made of materials that
may ignite, may cause overheating of the fan, and may impede proper function of the fans. The facility must ensure that
there is an effective program for the control of avian pests in place.
Correct by 06 August 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
A category E protocol (220603) did not include a search term for the method of death, drowning, in pitfall traps of small 
mammals. This method does not meet the definition of euthanasia, ('the humane destruction of an animal accomplished 
by a method that produces rapid unconsciousness and subsequent death without evidence of pain or distress'), and the 
IACUC must be assured that a thorough search for alternatives was performed. The facility must ensure that an 
appropriate search for and evaluation of alternatives is done. 
 
Correct by 30 August 2024. 
2.36(b)(7) 
   
Annual report. 
The annual report did not include an explanation of the category E procedure on protocol 220603. Documentation of the 
use of animals annually, with discussion of any IACUC approved exceptions to standards and regulations under the AWA, 
ensures public accountability for animal research. The facility must ensure that the annual report fully describes all animal 
use. 
 
Correct by 30 August 2024. 
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
The dairy barn had multiple sites where use and/or animals had damaged the facility: a rusted sharp end of a pole on the 
walkway (@2x4"), a rusted sharp edged hole at the bottom of a metal pillar at the edge of the milking parlor (@4x8"), two 
sharp edged holes in the metal wall covering in the heifer pen (@6x10"), and an @ 3x16" loose, flapping sharp plastic 
edge portion of a calf hutch. The damages to the facilities represent injury risks to the animals. The facility must ensure 
that animal handling and holding areas are kept in good repair to prevent injury to the animals. 
Correct by 06 August 2024 
 
The ceiling of the dairy barn had excessive dust/dirt/manure present over the animal stalls in large sections near the

ceiling fans. The buildup of dirt and excreta may be detrimental to the health of the animals. and prevent the fans from 
appropriately functioning to circulate air and cool the barn. The facility must ensure that the premises are kept clean and 
in good repair to facilitate appropriate husbandry practices. 
Correct by 30 August 2024. 
 
The top of the water heater in the calf treatment room was covered in dirt, white soap powder, and rust on the electrical 
connections, and the room itself was dirty, with manure and debris present on the floor and surfaces. Corrosion and 
damage to the water heater may prevent correct function and lack of housekeeping in the room may lead to 
contamination of feed or medication prepared in that area, which can impact animal health.  
The facility must ensure that the premises shall be kept clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
Correct by 06 August 2024. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Three of the large suspended ceiling fans had bird nests built into and upon them. The nests are made of materials that 
may ignite, may cause overheating of the fan, and may impede proper function of the fans. The facility must ensure that 
there is an effective program for the control of avian pests in place. 
 
Correct by 06 August 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
